name: Chewy & Moist Chocolate Chip Cookies
ingredients: ¾ cup unsalted butter, melted and slightly cooled
instructions: Whisk together the flour, cornstarch, baking soda, and salt.
In a large bowl, whisk the melted butter, brown sugar, and granulated sugar.
Add the egg, egg yolk, and vanilla extract and mix until well combined.
Gradually add the dry ingredients, mixing just until combined.
Cover and refrigerate the dough for at least 2 hours.
Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C) and line baking sheets with parchment paper.
Scoop about 1.5 tablespoons of dough per cookie, roll into balls, and place 2 inches apart.
Bake for 10-12 minutes, rotating the pan halfway through.
Let cool on the baking sheet for 5 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack.

storage_tips.room_temp: Store in an airtight container for up to 5 days with a slice of bread to keep them soft.
storage_tips.freezing_dough: Freeze pre-scooped dough, bake from frozen.
storage_tips.freezing_cookies: Freeze baked cookies for up to 3 months.
